ODESZA Announce New Side Project & Collaborative LP with Golden Features

Posted by Brittany Prevost on April 27, 2020

There's no arguing that this year has not gone according to anyone's plan. Although the current state of the world is less than favourable, there's always one thing that we can look to, and can count on, during dark times: good music. Recently, ODESZA unexpectedly revealed a new joint album alongside Golden Features, proving, once again, how much of a positive impact music can have on everyone's lives.

The welcomed announcement certainly came as a surprise as the Foreign Family label heads have been relatively quiet since they unleashed their acclaimed A Moment Apart studio album in 2017. On the other hand, Golden Features has continued to drop hit singles such as 'Falling Out' and 'Paradise', not to mention his remix of ODESZA's 'Falls'¬†featuring Sasha Sloan¬†showcased how the trio's distinct sounds can work so well together.

Although there haven't been many details¬†disclosed¬†as of yet, fans can count on a complete¬†album as ODESZA and Golden Features have come together to form BRONSON.¬†One of LA's premier events companies Brownies and Lemonade has hinted on social media that the album could be dropping soon. This suggestion has sparked rumours of BRONSON potentially performing at Digital Mirage 2. Only time will tell...¬†
